intro: Berkheya zeyheri, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long-lasting blooms and drought tolerance.
